member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqAcquisition
member.summary: Defines methods for configuring a low-level acquisition.
member.remarks: Use acquisition methods to configure, start, and abort an image acquisition. These methods also let you examine a buffer during acquisition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqAcquisition.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the resources used by .
member.remarks: The method leaves the in an unusable state. In an unusable state, you cannot call methods or properties on the object.

has been disposed.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqAcquisition.Acquire
member.summary: Starts a synchronous acquisition to the buffers in the associated session buffer list.
member.exception:
The session has been disposed.
-or-
The buffer has been disposed.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqAcquisition.AcquireAsync
member.summary: Starts an asynchronous acquisition to the buffers in the associated session buffer list.
member.remarks: You use this method with the event. Add an event handler, and will raise the event. For a single-shot acquisition, will raise the event once when the acquisition is done. For continuous, will raise the event every time a frame is done.
member.exception:
The session has been disposed.
-or-
The buffer list has been disposed.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqAcquisition.Abort
member.summary: Stops an acquisition immediately.
member.returns: The last available buffer list index.
member.remarks:
This method clears all acquisition configuration, disassociates the session from the buffer list, and unregisters all acquisition triggers. Prior to starting a new acquisition, the buffer list and any acquisition triggers need to be reassociated with the session via
and , respectively. Use to stop an acquisition and maintain the current session configuration.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqAcquisition.Extract(System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Extracts a buffer from a continuous acquisition. This method will always release any previously extracted buffers.
member.param: Specifies the buffer number to extract from.
The actual cumulative buffer number that was extracted.
member.returns: If the requested image has been acquired and exists in memory, the method returns that image immediately. If the requested image has not yet been acquired, the method does not return until the image has been acquired or the timeout period has expired. If the requested image has already been overwritten, the method returns the most current image. If the buffer remains extracted long enough that the acquisition hardware wraps around the buffer list and encounters the extracted buffer again, the acquisition will stall, increment the lost frame count, and the extracted buffer will not be overwritten.
member.exception:
The session has been disposed.
-or-
The buffer list has been disposed.
No buffer list has been configured.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqAcquisition.Extract(NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqSpecialBuffer,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Extracts a buffer from a continuous acquisition. This method will always release any previously extracted buffers.
member.param: Specifies the buffer to extract from.
The actual cumulative buffer number that was extracted.
member.returns: If the requested image has been acquired and exists in memory, the method returns that image immediately. If the requested image has not yet been acquired, the method does not return until the image has been acquired or the timeout period has expired. If the requested image has already been overwritten, the method returns the most current image. If the buffer remains extracted long enough that the acquisition hardware wraps around the buffer list and encounters the extracted buffer again, the acquisition will stall, increment the lost frame count, and the extracted buffer will not be overwritten.
member.remarks: If is passed in as the , this method returns .
member.exception:
The session has been disposed.
-or-
The buffer list has been disposed.
No buffer list has been configured.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqSerialConnection
member.summary: Defines serial communication methods that are used with image acquisition devices that support serial communication.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqSerialConnection.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes data to the serial port.
member.param: Data to send.
Time, in milliseconds, to wait for the data to be written.
member.remarks: Serial communication parameters, such as baud rate, are set in the camera file associated with the session. You can adjust these communication parameters directly in the camera file.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqSerialConnection.Read(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads in data from the serial port on image acquisition devices that support serial communication.
member.param: The maximum number of bytes to read.
Time, in milliseconds, to wait for the data to be read.
member.returns: Data from the serial port.
member.remarks: This method fills the buffer with characters received from the serial port until either a termination character has been received or the timeout period has elapsed. The termination character is defined in the camera file associated with the session.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqSerialConnection.ReadBytes(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads in an expected number of bytes from the serial port on image acquisition devices that support serial communication.
member.param: The number of bytes to read from the serial port.
Time, in milliseconds, to wait for the data to be read.
member.returns: Data from the serial port.
member.remarks: This method fills the buffer with characters received from the serial port until either the buffer is full or the timeout period has elapsed. When you use this method, the serial termination string attribute is ignored.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqSerialConnection.Flush
member.summary: Clears the internal serial buffer.
member.remarks: In a serial write/read sequence, call before calling to clear the internal serial buffer for the next read.

member.summary: Stops an acquisition in progress, releases resources associated with an acquisition, and closes the specified session.

Specifies whether to process Windows messages in the message queue. Set this to to avoid hanging the UI when calling close from a button event.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqSession.CalculateBayerColorLut(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.UInt32,System.Int32[]@,System.Int32[]@,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Calculates the red, green, and blue lookup tables (LUTs) based on the input gain values. Call this method before you enter the acquisition loop. You can then pass the LUTs to to quickly perform the color decode.
member.param: The gain used to generate the redLut. The value must be between 0 and 3.999.
The gain used to generate the greenLut. The value must be between 0 and 3.999.
The gain used to generate the blueLut. The value must be between 0 and 3.999.
The bits per pixel of the monochrome source image.

Pointer to an area of memory that will contain the red lookup table on return. For 8-bit images this array must contain 256 elements. For images with bit depths greater than 8, this array must contain 65,536 elements. You must allocate this array before passing it to the method.

Pointer to an area of memory that will contain the green lookup table on return. For 8-bit images this array must contain 256 elements. For images with bit depths greater than 8, this array must contain 65,536 elements. You must allocate this array before passing it to the method.

Pointer to an area of memory that will contain the blue lookup table on return. For 8-bit images this array must contain 256 elements. For images with bit depths greater than 8, this array must contain 65,536 elements. You must allocate this array before passing it to the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.Invert
member.summary: The invert image mode. If this is set to Invert, the image will be upside down in memory.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.NumBuffers
member.summary: The number of reserved driver buffers currently available.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorNtscSetupEnable
member.summary: Enables the setup correction of 7.5 IRE in NTSC mode. A standard NTSC signal has a setup level that moves up the black level 7.5% of the white level (or 7.5 IRE). Perform correction for this setup during acquisition by enabling this property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorBrightness
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of an image—the amount of white light added to or subtracted from each image pixel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorContrast
member.summary: The contrast of the image. The value is a scaling factor applied to every pixel. The contrast adjustment is centered around the median pixel value.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorSaturation
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation of the image—a factor multiplied to the chroma information of the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorTint
member.summary: The tint of the image. Tint is specified in degrees and corresponds to the rotation of the UV color plane. The default value is 0.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorImageRepresentation
member.summary: The type of image data returned when a color image is acquired.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorHueOffsetAngle
member.summary: Rotates the Hue plane with a specified offset angle. The hue value of a pixel is defined as an angle in the normal color plane. You can offset this angle to move the discontinuity point (at 0 modulo 360°) to another angle value.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.LastValidFrame
member.summary: Returns the integer of the last valid frame.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ClockFrequency
member.summary: The maximum pixel clock frequency of the device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.BlackReferenceLevel
member.summary: The black reference level of the channel associated with this session. The black reference level must be less than the white reference level.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.WhiteReferenceLevel
member.summary: The white reference level, in volts, of the channel associated with this session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.SerialNumber
member.summary: The serial number of the image acquisition device associated with this session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.RowPixels
member.summary: The true width (in pixels) of a horizontal line in memory. Used to calculate the memory offset of the next line.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.AcquireField
member.summary: The field acquired when FrameField is set to Field. When FrameField is set to Frame, this attribute is the first field that is acquired in time.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.PClockDetect
member.summary: Determines if the existence of a pixel clock is checked before starting an acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.VhaMode
member.summary: The variable height acquisition mode associated with this session.

member.summary: The lower limit for the binary threshold lookup table (LUT).

member.summary: The upper limit for the binary threshold lookup table (LUT).

member.summary: Selects different bandwidths for the luminance signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorChromaTrap
member.summary: The processing applied to the chroma signal.

member.summary: Selects the type of comb filter used in the luma path.

member.summary: Enables the peaking filter in the luma path.

member.summary: Enables/disables chroma processing.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorChromaBandwidth
member.summary: The resulting bandwidth of the chroma information of the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorChromaComb
member.summary: The type of comb filter used in the chroma path.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorRgbCoringLevel
member.summary: Selects the RGB coring level. On any image pixel, if the color saturation of the pixel is lower than the specified value, the saturation is set to zero, which results in a monochrome pixel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorHslCoringLevel
member.summary: The HSL coring level when ColorImageRepresentation is set to HSL. In HSL mode, if the saturation value (S) of on any image pixel is lower than the specified value, the Hue value (H) of the pixel is set to the Hue Replace Value.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorHueReplaceValue
member.summary: The value used to replace the hue when it is below ColorHslCoringLevel. You use this attribute only when the ColorImageRepresentation is set to HSL.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorGainRed
member.summary: The gain applied to the red color plane of the RGB image. This gain also affects the red data used to calculate the hue, saturation, and luminance planes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorGainGreen
member.summary: The gain applied to the green color plane of the RGB image. This gain also affects the green data used to calculate the hue, saturation, and luminance planes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.ColorGainBlue
member.summary: The gain applied to the blue color plane of the RGB image. This gain also affects the blue data used to calculate the hue, saturation, and luminance planes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.CalibrationDateLV
member.summary: The calibration date of the image acquisition device in a time-zone independent number of seconds that have elapsed since LabVIEW's epoch (12:00 a.m., Friday, January 1, 1904). A calibration date of 0 means uncalibrated.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.CalibrationDate
member.summary: The calibration date of the image acquisition device in a time-zone independent number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00 a.m., Friday, January 1, 1904, Universal Time. A calibration date of 0 means uncalibrated.

member.summary: The amount of current sourced by the Direct Drive lighting controller, in milliamperes (mA). This property can be set regardless of the status of the LightingMode attribute. This property is valid only for NI 17xx smart cameras.

member.summary: Enables/disables the 5 V TTL external lighting strobe signal to be used with external lighting controllers. This property is valid only for NI 17xx smart cameras.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.LightingExternalStrobe24V
member.summary: Enables/disables the 24 V external lighting strobe signal for external lighting controllers. This property is valid only for NI 17xx smart cameras.

member.summary: The exposure time of the image sensor in milliseconds. This property is valid only for NI 17xx smart cameras.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.FrameRate
member.summary: Sets/gets the desired frame rate of the image sensor, in frames per second. Setting the frame rate automatically enables FixedFrameRateMode. This property only takes effect when no buffer trigger is configured. This property is valid only for NI 17xx smart cameras.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.MaxFrameRate
member.summary: The maximum achievable frame rate, in frames per second, under the current configuration. This property is valid only for NI 17xx smart cameras.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.SendSoftwareTrigger
member.summary: Issues a trigger for an action configured to wait for a software trigger. This property is valid only for NI 17xx smart cameras.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqStandardAttribute.FixedFrameRateMode
member.summary: Enables/disables the fixed-frame-rate mode of the image sensor. When this property is enabled, the sensor acquires images at the rate specified by the FrameRate property. When this property is disabled, the sensor acquires images at the maximum possible frame rate. This property is ignored when a buffer trigger is configured. This property is valid only for NI 17xx smart cameras.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqTrigger.Configure(NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqTriggerAction,System.Int32)
member.summary: Configures an acquisition to start based on an external trigger.
member.param: The action to take when the trigger edge occurs.
The time, in milliseconds, to wait for the trigger to occur.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqTrigger.Configure(NationalInstruments.Vision.Acquisition.Imaq.ImaqTriggerAction,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Configures an acquisition to start based on an external trigger.
member.param: The action to take when the trigger edge occurs.
The time, in milliseconds, to wait for the trigger to occur.

The number of triggers to skip before acquiring a new line. For example, if you are using an encoder to trigger lines and it outputs 1,000 ticks per revolution, but you want to acquire only 10 lines per revolution, set this parameter to 99. Set this parameter to 0 to acquire a line on every trigger.
